## Synthetic thinking phase model MOVA

## Combining FSM with empathic understanding:

The synthetic model combines **machine precision of FSM** with **humanistic understanding** of emotional nuances of each thinking phase.

## 10 thinking phases (with empathic context):

| Phase Code | Phase Name | Empathic Description | Machine Logic | System Behavior |
|------------|------------|---------------------|---------------|-----------------|
| `perception` | Perception | Person reacts to stimulus - can be bodily, emotional, or image-based. This is initial reaction, not yet comprehended. | Initial state, input signal | **"I hear something touched you..."** |
| `confusion` | Uncertainty | Person feels confusion, lack of clarity. Characterized by vague statements, doubts. | Uncertainty state, structure seeking | **"This sounds like confusion. You feel something is unclear..."** |
| `naming` | Naming | Person tries to give naming to feeling or state. Often through metaphor or careful formulation. | Attempt at categorization, first concept | **"You're trying to name this feeling..."** |
| `framing` | Framing | Person creates hypothesis, category, or point of view. Begins to see problem boundaries. | Mental model creation | **"You're beginning to see the form of this question..."** |
| `exploration` | Exploration | Person actively explores ideas, possible solutions, scenarios, reasons. | Active search, option generation | **"You're exploring various possibilities..."** |
| `evaluation` | Evaluation | Person critically reflects on options, doubts, internal comparisons. | Critical analysis, comparison | **"You're weighing different sides..."** |
| `resolution` | Resolution | Person has internal conclusion or decision emerge. | Decision emergence, internal clarity | **"You're beginning to feel clarity..."** |
| `integration` | Integration | New meaning combines with previous experience. Person "settles" into new understanding. | New experience assimilation | **"You're integrating this understanding into yourself..."** |
| `action` | Action | Person exits to external world: decision, request, action. | External world output | **"You're ready to act with this understanding..."** |
| `reflection` | Retrospection | Person looks at experience from new perspective, completes thinking cycle. | Cycle completion, meta-analysis | **"You're looking back on this path..."** |
